DataElement.preferredName: Vitamin B12 Laboratory Test Result Picogram Per Milliliter Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Vitamin B12 test result value in pg/ml

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the result of the medical procedure that involves testing a sample for Vitamin B12.)_A cobalt-containing coordination compound produced by intestinal micro-organisms and found also in soil and water. Higher plants do not concentrate vitamin B 12 from the soil and so are a poor source of the substance as compared with animal tissues.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: A cobalt-containing coordination compound produced by intestinal micro-organisms and found also in soil and water. Higher plants do not concentrate vitamin B 12 from the soil and so are a poor source of the substance as compared with animal tissues.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: An essential nutrient and natural water-soluble vitamin of the B-complex family that must combine with an intrinsic factor for absorption by the intestine, Vitamin B12 (cyanocobalamin) is necessary for hematopoiesis, neural metabolism, DNA and RNA production, and carbohydrate, fat, and protein metabolism. B12 improves iron functions in the metabolic cycle and assists folic acid in choline synthesis. B12 metabolism is interconnected with that of folic acid. Vitamin B12 deficiency causes pernicious anemia, megaloblastic anemia, and neurologic lesions.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Laboratory Test Result Picogram Per Milliliter Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The outcome of a laboratory test in a Picogram Per Milliliter Value

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Laboratory Test Result Picogram Per Milliliter Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The outcome of a laboratory test.:The metric unit of mass equal to one trillionth of a gram (10E-12 gram).:For each, generally denoting a ratio.:A measure of volume for a liquid.  A milliliter is approximately 950 times smaller than a quart and 30 times smaller than a fluid ounce.  A milliliter of liquid and a cubic centimeter (cc) of liquid are the same.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The outcome of a laboratory test.
The metric unit of mass equal to one trillionth of a gram (10E-12 gram).
For each, generally denoting a ratio.
A unit of volume equal to one millionth (10E-6) of a cubic meter, one thousandth of a liter, one cubic centimeter, or 0.061023 7 cubic inch. A cubic centimeter is the CGS unit of volume.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
